metadata.titel_preek: The Axe at the Root of the Trees

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The arrival of the Cosmic Judge (Jesus) to dismantle human pretensions and create a new people (children of Abraham) from 'stones' (incapable humans).

tekstueel_bewijs: A power from outside is coming, a power that is able to make a new creation
God is able from these stones to raise up children
He will clear his threshing floor
making people new for his kingdom
The witness is from God; the light is from God; the preaching is from God
not so frightening to the poor and oppressed
people like us, stones like us

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Preaching Word

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'resistance to God' that requires an 'irresistible force' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical fruit-bearing of the believer as a consequence of being possessed by God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The New Person (Believer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Ethics is explicitly described as the 'fruit' or 'consequence' of the primary program (God's power).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → Jesus → Worldly Resistance

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is able from these stones to raise up children
It is God's power that gives good deeds
He will clear his threshing floor
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We really don’t know exactly what to do with him
I will cling to the Gucci luggage
We cannot trust any of the powers of this world

voorbeelden: summoning us to rethink and reorder our lives
the longing cry of God’s people
the vision given to the church that sees through the appearances
I need power from outside myself to make me different
people who have no capacity of ourselves to save ourselves

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on human impotence (lack of Pouvoir) and God's omnipotence. It rejects Devoir (moralism) as a catalyst for change.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (Domesticated Advent) to S2 (The Axe/Judgment), then exposes ~S1 (Human Pretension) as futile, finally landing on S1 (God's Power to create from stones).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking the role of Subject; the judgment (S2) is the very thing that clears the way for Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'unquenchable fire' and 'axe' are not softened.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly denies human agency in the process of salvation and repentance, attributing even the 'willing' and 'doing' to God's external power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: John is the model Christian preacher

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God's power that gives... even our repentance.
the world’s resistance to God meets the irresistible force

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John is used as a 'witness' or 'spotlight' rather than a moral hero to be imitated by human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John is a 'beam of light' pointing to the real Subject, Jesus.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and surrender; moving from anxiety about performance to hope in God's power.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God is the author of both justification and the resulting 'fruit'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: God's action (Program 1) enables human fruit-bearing (Program 2).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'unlovable' John and the 'rejoice' ending.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the collision of two forces... the irresistible force of the One who is coming

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: God gives the 'Pouvoir' (power) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; humans are described as 'stones' regarding their ability to change.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the sole Subject of the narrative engine.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this imbalance is theologically intentional for a grace-oriented sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It systematically dismantles the hearer's attempt to be the Subject of their own salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'spotlight' metaphor; Greimas shows that the metaphor actually functions to remove the preacher as an actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what John said; Greimas explains how the sermon's 'engine' uses John to shift the hearer into a state of 'expecting nothing from themselves.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—transferring the 'Pouvoir' from the hearer to God.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly quotes Pascal to reinforce the semiotic shift from human competence to divine endowment.
